metadata.title: CVE-2023-1989 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in btsdio_remove indrivers\bluetooth\btsdio.c in the Linux Kernel. In this flaw, a call tobtsdio_remove with an unfinished job, may cause a race problem leading to aUAF on hdev devices.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1989` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-1009-oem - 6.1.0-1009.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2, was needed').
linux-kvm package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
